column1: For two or three months I kept his wings clipped
column2: so that he could not fly far. When I went out for a walk
column4: either in my arms or perched on my hand; and thus I and my pet became known all over the neighborhood; and
column5: when my little playmates invited me to visit them
column6: an invitation was always sent for "Lillie and her pigeon."He followed me everywhere. If I was reading
column7: he rested on my chair; if playing on the piano
column8: he would listen attentively: indeed he acquired such a taste for music
column9: that the only time he ever seemed willing to leave me was to perch upon the foot of a gentleman who was singing very finely.I taught him a number of tricks
column10: such as bringing me any thing that he could carry
column11: lying down very still till I told him to get up
column12: and running over the piano-keys to make music for himself.
